intro: Hieracium sonchifolium, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers bloom from June to August, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and open habitats. Hieracium sonchifolium is also recognized as an invasive species in some regions due to its aggressive growth and ability to colonize new areas.
